byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and HWAIDA SAAD

abstract: Islamic State fighters continue siege on Syria's Yarmouk refugee camp, where thousands of dehydrated and malnourished Palestinian refugees remain trapped under worsening conditions; United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon strongly denounces militants and sends envoy to Damascus to seek solution.
lead_paragraph: United Nations officials said Friday that the siege of Yarmouk, the devastated refugee camp in Syria where 18,000 severely malnourished and dehydrated Palestinians are trapped, had only gotten worse.

headline.main: U.N. Warns of Deepening Crisis in Syrian Refugee Camp Overrun by Militants
headline.print_headline: U.N. Warns of Deepening Crisis in Syrian Refugee Camp Overrun by Militants

snippet: United Nations officials said Friday that the siege of Yarmouk, the devastated refugee camp in Syria where 18,000 severely malnourished and dehydrated Palestinians are trapped, had only gotten worse.
